data.title: Educational & Interesting
data.text: I learned so much from a simple, but complete well organized museum. make sure to spend time reading all the references and exploring details. A must visit.

data.title: Wedding venue is gorgeous!
data.text: My niece got married at the museum, and it is a beautiful place for a wedding.  They got married in the garden area and the reception moved to the area next to it.  It was very quaint and  actually roomy in the reception area.  The wedding area was a little tight.  However, I would recommend this venue for a late fall wedding or late spring wedding.  September was a little hot for this venue.  However, this was literally the only date available in 2016 for a wedding so she had to take it!

data.title: Not For Me
data.text: This is a self guided tour so if you are the type of person who will stop and read everything, this is for you. It is just a house of model ships throughout history. Yep, that's it. The most interesting part of the museum to me was the Titanic model. There is a small garden you can walk through as well. It wasn't my favorite visit but I can see how someone would love it.

data.title: Great Museum
data.text: We visited when they were also having an Art  Exhibit in the Gardens. The inside of the Museum was also excellent, with a great Gift Shop.

data.title: A gorgeous home, garden & museum in one!
data.text: This place was great to visit because you get to not only see another beautiful Savannah home & garden but also a museum with amazing ship models inside. My boyfriend who is a big 'ship/sea' person was completely captivated the entire time we were there. So many ship models to look at and very detailed & clear explanations about each one.

data.title: Really unique
data.text: The ship models in this museum are incredible. Take time to look at the amazing detail in each one. They are mostly made by the same artist. I learned a lot about the history of ships that came to Savannah as well as the changes in the way ships were built over the years. The history and life of these ships are facinating. The staff here are very knowledgeable and eager to share about the ships and the house. The building is beautifully restored. The gardens are beautiful as well. They often have weddings in the garden in the afternoons so you may want to visit early in the day.

data.title: Lovely gardens and quite the building also..
data.text: Ran across this by chance and stopped in since my husband and I are both water and history enthusiasts.  Guide at the front door was simply not to be missed.  He shared a wealth of information both about the museum but also about the house itself and its occupants.  So much history to be told about Savannah along with some simply amazing artifacts.  Gardens are both restful and beautiful - in fact they were setting up for a wedding when we were there.

data.title: Fantastic Museum with Great Ship Models in a beautiful house
data.text: As a Naval fans, My Wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the various local history in the ship models from various countries involved in Savannah. Don't miss the carved tusks by sailors/prisoners exhibit. The outside gardens are very nice as well.

data.title: Ship Museum
data.text: My husband and I went to this museum. Be warned that there isn't an elevator for the upper and basement floors so if you have mobility issues it could be a problem. There is also a staircase at the entrance of the museum, too! My husband enjoyed the museum, but I couldn't climb the stairs so I had an incomplete tour. We didn't know about the stairs until after we paid.

data.title: Very Cool
data.text:
Visited this museum and we were delighted by the items on display. The ship models were awesome as were the paintings and artifacts.
Definetly a place to visit if you have any interest in ships or shipping.

data.title: Beautiful Venue for Wedding!
data.text: We had a fabulous time at the Ships of the Sea Maritime Museum!  We attended a storybook wedding there!

data.title: History
data.text: Informative information! The models of ships are amazing. Details of the models are so helpful in picturing what life was like.

data.title: Very Interesting BUT one WARNING!
data.text: This is a very interesting museum, but there are lots of stairs and no elevator. They do not tell you this when you buy your ticket at the bus tour. To get into the museum you walk up several stairs and then there are narrow staircases to each floor-all 4 of them. The bathroom is one floor DOWN from the main floor. Just a warning ,in case you have any issues .

data.title: Viewing the past of the Maritime
data.text: This was a joy to view and observe. We didn't't expect something like this museum to be in Savannah Ga. All the displays brought back the seafaring tales of yesteryear. If you enjoy the Maritime and Sea adventures find your way to this Museum. You won't lack for any thing to see about the ships and ports in the various in the funding area. If you enjoy well cared after gardens then you'll enjoy the walk through to the Museum's entrance. Very nice indeed. I personally enjoyed chatting with several of the employees around the Museum. They knew the displays and we excited to share their knowledge. I'd say Have fun during your time in Savannah especially during a rainy day. thanks again to all the personnel who shared their knowledge. It was quite enlightening. Gary and Anne Hatton

data.title: For Ship Lovers
data.text: The collection of ships in this museum is very impressive. Though I was there to attend a wedding in the pavilion in the courtyard, I did take a look inside the museum. If you love ships and their history relative to Savannah you should check it out.

data.title: Loved!!!
data.text:
I absolutely loved the Sea Maritime Museum!!! It was very interesting! They had loads of displays of old maritime artifacts, ship models, tools, uniforms, and instruments. 

If you are military or AAA member you pay $7 instead of $9. Parking can be tricky in the area. Unless you get lucky to get a space on the street it's best to go with a garage. 

If you love ships, are retired navy, or just want something interesting to do on your visit - check out the Ships of the Sea Museum. It's worth a visit.

data.title: If you love ship models, this is the place for you.
data.text: Excellent display of ship models in a beautiful mansion. Two floors o local historic ships and an amazing replica of the Titanic in distress. All in glass cases, so shut off the flash on your camera or phone. I have a feeling young children will be a bit bored, as well as teens. But us 'mature' individuals, we're lovin' it. On he Old Town Trolley Stop, too.

data.title: An excellent Maritime Museum!
data.text:
If you love naval history then you have to visit here! It's set in a beautiful location with a lovely garden and a stately building.
The collection is immense over 3 levels and varied, covering many aspects of life at sea and the ships and trades. 
The staff we met were excellent, brilliant and historians in their own right and really brought the history to life with their knowledge and passion!
The USS Savannah is commemorated here and it is a ships story well worth hearing, such bravery, sacrifice and duty shown by the ships company of that proud warship!
For British visitors... the figurehead of HMS Collosus is here too, I was astounded!
I will be back but I say "Keep up the good work!" and honestly you could give many larger and greater funded maritime museums a run for their money - you do far better!

data.title: Ship model heaven
data.text: This museum has a terrific combination of large ship models and their detailed history, as well as historical paintings on the walls and displays of other nautical ephemera.  As a previous reviewer mentioned, it may not be a spot to take the very young - most displays stand at adult height.  It would be a good rainy day trip.  Look for the usual ticket discounts.

data.title: What a great small museum in a wonderful building and setting!
data.text: I wasn't sure what to expect of the museum before going - my experience with smaller museums has been inconsistent at best. But from the greeting I received - welcoming, informed, and helpful - I was optimistic! (unfortunately I don't recall the name of the gentleman working the desk) The building itself is beautiful, an old house divided into, I think 6 different rooms over 3 levels.  It's a marvelous, interesting collection of model vessels (i have always loved ship models since I was a kid), nautical paintings, original artifacts and, the two highlights for me, some beautiful scrimshaw and boats in bottles. The grounds themselves are also quite beautiful - calm, shady and relaxing. So if you like things nautical in general as well as those with good local content and insight I highly recommend checking out this little gem.
